page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: HAREWOOD ARMS. NEXT TO OUR SCHOOL IS THE HAREWOOD ARMS. THIS IS AN OLD COACHING INN. IT WAS BUILT IN 1810.THERE ARE 20 LETTING BEDROOMS AND THE HOTEL IS OPEN TO NON-RESIDENTS.DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS IT IS BUSY WITH TOURISTS,AND DURING THE WINTER MONTHS IS USED BY BUSINESSMEN.IN THE COURTYARD AT THE BACK YOU CAN SEE STABLES WHERE 40 HORSES COULD HAVE BEEN KEPT.100 YEARS AGO UP TO 22 COACHES A DAY CALLED AT THE ARMS BUT BY 1859 THIS WAS REDUCED TO 1 WITH THE COMING OF THE RAILWAYS. A BLACKSMITH IN THE VILLAGE HAS BEEN REPLACED BY A GARAGE SELLING PETROL. IN 1985 THE HAREWOOD ARMS IS BEING REFURBISHED.
